revised_title: Muscular Varieties of the Human Neck, Shoulder, and Chest: Homologies in Mammalia
tldr: The author, John Wood, examines various muscular varieties in the human neck, shoulder, and chest, and their homologies in mammals. He discusses the occipito-scapular, levator claviculce, and cleido-occipital muscles, as well as their transitional forms and connections to other muscles. The study includes observations from numerous animals and references to previous anatomists' work.
